Vocabularies.Definition: v.  exchange (one thing) for another 交换
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I'll swap my orange for your apple.

Vocabularies.Definition: mention or describe (sb. or sth.) as 将……称为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The professor referred to him as a graduate student with a bright future.

Vocabularies.Definition: get in 带进来；收获
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We have brought in a good grain harvest for three years on end.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.      个人用品，衣物；装备；齿轮
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  All our camping gear has been packed up.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  move from one place to another 迁移
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In winter, some birds migrate to find warmer weather.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  proof; a declaration by a witness  证明；证词
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A witness gave testimony that the accused was drunk.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.      fill completely; soak 使充满；浸透
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The air was saturated with the perfume of the flowers.

Vocabularies.Definition: mention a subject briefly 提起，谈到
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The book touches on the issue, but only superficially.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.     select and set aside for a specific purpose 选定（或指定）……（作某种用途）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He designated Smith as his successor.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   force into less space 压缩
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He compressed his report into three pages.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  express grief or discontent 悲叹，抱怨
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Almost immediately he began to complain about the weather.

Vocabularies.Definition: relevant(ly) 相关的（地），切中要害的（地）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What he was saying is short and to the point.

Vocabularies.Definition: examine, inspect 查阅，察看
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Look over your exercises before handing them in.

Vocabularies.Definition: expel 赶走，驱逐
n.     定义；释义
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There is no general agreement on a standard definition of intelligence.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    谱，范围
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The term "special needs" covers a wide spectrum of problems.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   双重的
n.   a favorable position or factor, sth. good 优势，优点，好处
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Mary speaks good English, but she has an advantage because her mother is English.

Vocabularies.Definition: sit comfortably; become quiet or calm; begin living a stable and orderly life 舒适地坐下；平静下来；定居
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He settled down to marking the examination papers.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   always moving about, unable to remain still 一直在动的， 停不下来的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The sick child passed a restless night.
